metadata.title: CVE-2020-12825 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
libcroco through 0.6.13 has excessive recursion in cr_parser_parse_any_corein cr-parser.c, leading to stack consumption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcroco-tools - 0.6.12-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
libcroco3 - 0.6.12-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libcroco package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.12-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
gnome-shell package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
